meanings.definition: To strike with a sharp blow or slap.
meanings.sent1: I saw the fly whap against the window.
meanings.sent2: She whapped the table to get everyone's attention.
meanings.sent3: The chef whapped the dough to flatten it for the pizza.
meanings.sent4: The wind whapped the flag against the pole.
meanings.sent5: He whapped the ball with all his might, sending it flying.

meanings.sent1: The whap of the ruler hitting the desk echoed in the classroom.
meanings.sent2: He felt the whap of the branch hitting his back as he ran through the forest.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected whap on the shoulder made her jump in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The loud whap of the door closing behind him signaled his departure.
meanings.sent5: The whap of the newspaper hitting the porch announced the morning delivery.
